description.narrative: A joint project between Finland the African Development Bank (AfDB) and the Nordic Development FUnd (NDF) aims to support the mainstreaming of circular economy solutions in African countries. The objective of the impact level is to help convert production and consumption on the continent into a circular economy. At the output level the aim is to create favorable conditions for the circular economy by strengthening the capacity of public and private sector actors and encouraging the launch and replication of new circular economy business models. As a basis for this the project will produce circular economy policies institutional capacity building programs and pilot circular economy projects.The circular economy is based on a holistic approach to sustainabilit y from energy and material efficiency to the reuse / elimination of waste throughout the product life cycle. In a circular economy the global economy is in transition shifting from production to services and using the benefits of digitalisation for streaml ining global production chains. Promoting a circular economy supports climate policy and in particular the achievement of long-term emission reduction targets.Finland is a pioneer in a carbon-neutral circular economy. In 2016 Finland was the first in the w orld to publish its national circular economy roadmap. The Roadmap has been widely implemented by both the public and private sectors from grassroots upwards and was updated in 2019. Finland's experience has made it possible to engage in content-rich polic y dialogue promote institutional cooperation and increase the impact of development cooperation on new technologies and activities. It is proposed that the project quality board will support funding Circular Economy Trust Fund in the African Development Ba nk for EUR 2.0 million for the period 2020-2022.
